messages.title: Dear Resident,
messages.content: Your postal vote ballot paper will arrive shortly and you will have the opportunity to vote for the change that Britain desperately needs. Britain faces a clear choice: five more years of Gordon Brown, or change with the Conservatives.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A Conservative government will stop Labour's tax on working people by cutting waste in Government. Backing the NHS. Ensure there is decent pension for all.
Back the NHS. Will increase spending on health every year and make the NHS work for patients not managers.

Ensure there is decent pension for all. We will re-link the basic state pension to earnings and give pensioners more help with their bills, by taking action to freeze council tax for up to five years.
Get Britain on the move and into work. Make people off welfare and into work. Make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In Heywood & Middleton only the Conservative Party can defeat Labour.

issues.economy: A Conservative government will stop Labour's tax on working people by cutting waste in Government.
issues.health: Back the NHS. Will increase spending on health every year and make the NHS work for patients not managers.
issues.socialWelfare: Ensure there is decent pension for all. We will re-link the basic state pension to earnings and give pensioners more help with their bills, by taking action to freeze council tax for up to five years.

housing.content: A Conservative government will: ... Stop Labour's tax on working people - their planned rise in National Insurance tax - by cutting waste in Government. As a result, save over 60,000 jobs over the risk of small and medium-sized businesses, stop almost 60,000 people being lost in than under Labour.

images.caption: Images of MIKE HOLLY and DAVID GARNETT.

leaflet.additionalNotes: In Heywood & Middleton only the Conservative Party can defeat Labour. We came second in the 2008 General Election and in both recent elections, for the European Parliament and the 2008 Council Election we topped the polls for Heywood & Middleton with the Liberal Democrats in a poor third place in the latter.
